content: socks are my favorite i have been making and teaching socks for many years this is my basic toe-up reinforced heel flap recipe it is worked in a heavy fingering weight yarn knitted tighter than suggested gauge so that it will wear for a long time my oldest pair of socks is 9 years old no holes yet as the pattern is written these are suitable to be worked in magic loop or on 2 circular needles the sizes listed are in us shoe sizes for guidance in narrowing down which size to knit these are meant to be worn with negative ease choose a size with finished measurements of about ½-1 inch less than your measurement i have included instructions for 3 sizes which can accommodate 10 different shoes sizes both men s and women s foot length and leg length are adjustable to the individual knitter and toe-up socks are easy to try on as you go which i encourage you to do often approximately 100 grams of sock yarn is required although if you choose to make a longer sock leg you may need extra yardage i used sock yarn leftovers for the sample this pattern can be used as a template to help you de-stash your sock yarn hoard skills needed judy s magic cast-on here http //knitty com/issuespring06/featmagiccaston html working in the round using either magic loop https //tutorials knitpicks com/magic-loop/ or 2 circular method https //tutorials knitpicks com/knitting-in-the-round-with-2-circular-needles/ increasing short row bind off using a stretchy method https //www interweave com/article/knitting/a-stretchier-bind-off/ gauge 32sts and 11 rounds/4 needles 2 5mm circular needles 32 length for magic loop or 2 pairs 2 5mm circular needles 16 length for socks on two circs this is my first written pattern all feedback is very welcome i hope you enjoy carlie
